articles.title: Greetings to Supreme Council of United Malays National Organization of Malaysia
articles.content:
Greetings to Supreme Council of United Malays National Organization of Malaysia
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, in a message on Sunday warmly congratulated the Supreme Council of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia on the 69th anniversary of its founding.
					 The message sincerely wished the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia greater successes in its activities to realize the national unity and achieve progress and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Delegations of different countries and regions visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio on Sunday. They came to Pyongyang to take part in the 18th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair.
					 The guests laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: National Machine Design Festival Held
articles.content:
National Machine Design Festival Held
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The 11th National Machine Design Festival took place here from May 4 to 10.
					 It brought together designers, teachers, researchers, technicians, workers and three-revolution team members of design, education and scientific research institutions and many other units.
					
					 The festival was aimed to introduce achievements made in the drive for thoroughly carrying out the Workers' Party of Korea's policy of decisively putting designs on higher scientific basis as required by the new century and to generalize them and thus give full play to the potentials of the machine-building industry of the country.
					
					 It included machine design display, multi-dimensional design contest, design prize contest and dissemination of cutting-edge design techniques. Displayed and published at the festival were machine product designs conducive to improving the people's living standard, research data on developing design technique and machine design programs.
					
					 Also presented there were designs of equipment on the use of natural energy including wind energy, solar heat and geothermal energy.
					
					 Highly appreciated at the festival were those that hold weighty significance in settling urgent issues. And certificates were awarded to those who presented them.
					
					 Kim Chaek University of Technology, Hamhung University of Hydraulic Engineering and the Ryongsong Machine Designing Institute of the Ryongsong Machine Complex proved successful at the multi-dimensional design contest.

articles.title: DPRK Girl Gymnast Wins Gold Medal at World Challenge Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Girl Gymnast Wins Gold Medal at World Challenge Cup
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK gymnast Kang Yong Mi won a gold medal in the woman uneven bar at the 2015 FIG artistic gymnastic world challenge cup that has been underway in Bulgaria from May 7.
					 It brought together more than 100 men and women players from 25 countries and regions including the DPRK, France, Switzerland, Austria and Uzbekistan.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps S. Korean Authorities' "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps S. Korean Authorities' "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the U.S. and south Korean authorities held a UN "seminar on human rights in the north" and "seminar of defectors from the north" in New York. Those present there let loose a spate of invectives against the DPRK.
					 Meanwhile, the gentries of the south Korean puppet Foreign Ministry have kept them busy concluding an agreement on setting up the UN "office for human rights in the north" in Seoul and opening it within next month.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday terms it a strange burlesque of top-class human rights abusers unaware of where they stand.
					
					 It is an unpardonable mockery and insult to the dignity and rights of human being that the puppet forces are talking about "human rights" as they are prolonging their remaining days through fascist suppression aimed at reigning over the people, as the colonial servants for the U.S., the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Lurking behind their moves is to tarnish the image of the DPRK in international arena, destroy the single-minded unity of all its service personnel and people and bring down its socialist system.
					
					 It is nonsensical for the south Korean puppet authorities to talk about dialogue with the DPRK while malignantly slandering its dignity and social system through groundless "human rights" rackets.
					
					 The puppet authorities had better stop acting rashly, seriously contemplating the catastrophic consequences their anti-DPRK "human rights" racket will affect on the north-south ties.

articles.title: Director of Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency Indicted
articles.content:
Director of Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency Indicted
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The April 16 Family Consultative Council in south Korea held a press conference at the Kwanghwamun plaza in Seoul on May 6 at which it indicted the puppet security authorities for violating freedom of assembly, demonstration and speech.
					 The organization indicted the director of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency.
					
					 It charged that the director ordered the police to repress the demonstrators and supervise the venue of the rally through cameras set up around Kwanghwamun on April 18 when the people staged actions to demand a probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 This fell foul of relevant law as the cameras were used for other purpose, it held. 
					
					 The police fired water guns mixed tear liquid at the participants in the rally, wounding several, it added.

articles.title: S. Korean Police's Illegal Use of Tear Liquid Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Police's Illegal Use of Tear Liquid Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, in an editorial on May 7 denounced the puppet police for ruthlessly suppressing the actions of people of all social standings by firing tear liquid at them.
					 The editorial charged that the police indiscriminately fired tear liquid at demonstrators when they tried to march to Chongwadae in demand of the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster, thus wounding them.
					
					 Demonstrators said that the police endangered the people's life without any legal ground, it said.
					
					 The police's suppression is not only an illegal act but a grave encroachment on the freedom and rights of the people, it noted.
					
					 The April 16 Family Consultative Council filed a suit against the police over its suppression, it said. It demanded the "constitutional court" make a correct judgment.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces' Racket for Confrontation with Compatriots Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces' Racket for Confrontation with Compatriots Censured
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet minister of Unification, clarifying the stand on "promoting NGOs exchange" on May 1 as regards the end of the joint military exercises with the U.S., vociferated about the "normalization of south-north relations", "positive support to NGOs exchange" and "humanitarian work for the north".
					 Very disgusting is that the confrontation maniacs are crying out for "promoting NGOs exchange" though they pulled up the DPRK just some days ago, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article. It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces have driven the north-south relations into a catastrophe and laid hurdles in the way of north-south NGOs exchange by waging the north-targeted joint military exercises with foreign forces and by launching smear campaign. They are so impudent as they trumpet about "NGOs exchange", far from apologizing for their crimes before the whole nation and retracting the policy for confrontation. This is a revelation of their sinister intention.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that their act is nothing but a crafty scheme to conceal their crimes against reunification in which they pushed the north-south relations to an extreme phase of tension and to shift the blame on to the DPRK and tide over the ruling crisis.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the puppet forces cover up their ugly colors as confrontation maniacs.
					
					 It is utterly impossible for the DPRK to discuss with the puppet forces the issue of improving the ties, now that they are persisting in the moves for a war and smear campaign against it in league with foreign forces, with dagger in their belt.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Not Seeking People's Understanding
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Not Seeking People's Understanding
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee for Ferry Sewol Disaster of the south Korean Council of Christian Churches issued a statement on May 7 to denounce the puppet forces for railroading the "enforcement ordinance".
					 The statement demanded the present chief executive immediately renegotiate the "enforcement ordinance" of the special law on the ferry Sewol.
					
					 The regime passed the "enforcement ordinance" through the "state council meeting" on May 6, revealing once again its real intention to realize its attempt, the statement said.
					
					 The "enforcement ordinance" does not ensure the independence and neutrality of the ad hoc committee for investigation into the ferry Sewol disaster and grant those to be investigated the full mandate for the operation of the ad hoc committee, it noted.
					
					 It denounced the attitude of the regime which left the poisonous articles as intact as an expression of ignorance of the people's intention.

articles.title: Official of Regional Body Backs Just Cause of Korean People
articles.content:
Official of Regional Body Backs Just Cause of Korean People
						
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- E. A. Vidyasekera, coordinating secretary of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization, on May 4 made public a statement in denunciation of the U.S. for being hell-bent on strengthening military alliance with Japan, and in support of the just cause of the Korean people.
					 The U.S. has recently made a new amendment of "guidelines on defense cooperation" with Japan, the statement said, alluding to the keynote of the new "guidelines" calling for enhancing the role of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces".
					
					 What is ridiculous is the U.S. allegation that the "guidelines" are to cope with the "threat" from the DPRK, the statement said, stressing:
					
					 People with proper senses must understand where the threat comes from.
					
					 It is not hard to guess that what the U.S. seeks in revising the "guidelines" is to expand the role of the SDF to relieve the U.S. of its burden of a fabulous amount of military spending, use Japan as a shock brigade in realizing its ambition for world hegemony, militarily encircle and contain its rivals in Eurasia and keep its position for domination.
					
					 In such situation we consider that the DPRK has been compelled to bolster up the capabilities for self-defense with nuclear deterrence as a pivot, while invariably pursuing Songun politics.

articles.title: German Organization Introduces DPRK
articles.content:
German Organization Introduces DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany posted an article titled "Complete abolition of the agricultural tax in kind" on its website on April 29 to introduce the DPRK.
					 The article said:
					
					 The system of the agricultural tax in kind which had been instituted in Korea after its liberation positively aroused the farmers to the building of a new country and promoted the solution of the food issue and industrial development. The agricultural tax in kind gradually has taken concrete shape in the direction of providing the conveniences of the farmers. In the period of the past Fatherland Liberation War the farmers were completely exempted from the tax or its rate lowered. 
					
					 Under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung the agricultural tax in kind was abolished in the 1964-1966 period in the DPRK.
					
					 With the complete abolition of the tax the economic foundation in the cooperative farms of the DPRK was further strengthened and rural areas changed into socialist ones.
					
					 This freed farmers from tax burden for ever and their standard of living further improved.
